Ever expanding on the diversity in our forcefields, we have added RNA to the  Martini force field [1]. For feedback on the RNA package please communicate via the forum or send an e-mail to [i.faustino@rug.nl](i.faustino@rug.nl).

The Martini RNA comes in a package with a martinize script to generate the Martini topology files for RNA and DNA molecules. It also includes a backmapping file to convert the coarse RNA into atomistic RNA (AMBER and CHARMM) using our [backmapping procedure](http://cgmartini.nl/index.php/tutorials-general-introduction/others#Backward) [2]. If you want to start running your first Martini RNA system, you can follow the tutorial we have prepared [here](http://cgmartini.nl/index.php/tutorials-general-introduction-gmx5/tutorial-martini-rna-gmx5).

- [na-tutorials_20170815.tar](http://cgmartini.nl/images/stories/tutorial/2017/na-tutorials_20170815.tar)

[1] Uusitalo, Jaakko J., et al. Martini Coarse-Grained Force Field: Extension to RNA. Biophys. J. 2017. 113, 2, 246-256. [PubMed](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28633759)

[2] Wassenaar, T. A., Pluhackova, K., Böckmann, R. A., Marrink, S. J., and Tieleman, D. P.
